subject: Re: [LSF/MM/BPF TOPIC] Where is fuse going? API cleanup, restructuring and more

reviews.author: Amir Goldstein
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised several points, including the potential for using fuse improvements to phase out old, unmaintained filesystems, and the need for a one-time conversion from kernel/vfs API to userspace/lowlevel FUSE API.

reviews.author: Miklos Szeredi (author)
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about the maturity of the BPF design and its readiness for discussion, also questioning the effort required to port unmaintained kernel filesystems to a new framework.

reviews.author: Jan Kara
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Jan Kara, expressed skepticism about the feasibility of API cleanup and restructuring for certain filesystems, citing small user bases and minimal testing.

reviews.author: Luis Henriques
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Luis Henriques, expressed agreement and enthusiasm for the proposed topics and session, suggesting that his own topic on restarting FUSE servers could be merged into the existing list.

reviews.author: John Groves
reviews.summary: Reviewer John Groves expressed interest in attending a session on fuse API cleanup and restructuring, but didn't provide any technical feedback or concerns.

reviews.author: Joanne Koong
reviews.summary: Joanne Koong suggested two new items to discuss in the context of fuse API cleanup and restructuring: leveraging io-uring multishot for batching requests and settling how load distribution should be done for configurable queues.

reviews.author: Darrick Wong
reviews.summary: Reviewer Darrick Wong raised concerns about the scope and complexity of the fuse API cleanup, suggesting that it's too large for online discussion and recommending in-person meetings to reach consensus on broader topics.

reviews.author: Horst Birthelmer
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Horst Birthelmer, expressed interest in discussing the proposed changes and architectural shifts for FUSE, but did not provide any specific technical feedback or concerns.

reviews.author: Bernd Schubert
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about the patch bomb and requested clarification on the order of review, as well as suggested creating separate PRs for libfuse patches to avoid test failures.

reviews.author: Gao Xiang
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Gao Xiang, expressed concerns about FUSE becoming complex and having a leak of security design. They suggested that allowing unprivileged non-root-ns mounts for container users should be a per-filesystem policy rather than an arbitrary one.

reviews.author: John Groves
reviews.summary: The reviewer raised concerns about how the proposed changes would interact with existing code, specifically regarding dax_iomap_rw() and dax_iomap_fault(). He also mentioned that he needs the dax_iomap* interface to work with his own drivers.
